channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Top Lebanese official's bodyguard is spotted firing live rounds at protesters
item.description: Sporting jeans and a black top, the bodyguard pointed a firearm at swarms of demonstrators yesterday afternoon and allegedly shot rounds over their heads amid escalating protests in Lebanon.

item.title: Tesco supermarket is hit by coronavirus outbreak amid surge in Covid cases across Swindon
item.description: Tesco has confirmed that the affected staff at its Extra store in Swindon, Wiltshire, (pictured) are now self-isolating.

item.title: UK weather: Britain to swelter under TEN-day heatwave
item.description: The UK is experiencing an extraordinary period of scorching weather, with the mercury now having been above the official heatwave level of over 82F (28C) since last Wednesday.

item.title: India Willoughby urgesthe government to 'put up a barbed wire fence like Trump'
item.description: India Willoughby sparked outrage when she claimed we should 'go down the Trump route' in order to stop migrants entering the UK.

item.title: Doctor Who Blink location house in Wales goes on sale for £2million
item.description: The 170-year-old Fields Manor, near Newport in South Wales, featured prominently in the classic 2007 episode, Blink, starring David Tennant as the Doctor, and Carey Mulligan as Sally Sparrow.

item.title: This Morning Doctor warns that STAFF ROOMS could be a hotbed for coronavirus
item.description: Dr Sara Kayat appeared on This Morning as she warned that teachers would need to be 'more careful' in the staff room as schools across the UK prepare to reopen in September.

item.title: Mauritians use home-made barriers of straw, tights and HAIR to contain oil spill
item.description: More than 1,000 tonnes of oil have oozed from the bulk carrier MV Wakashio, befouling the fishing waters and pristine lagoons of Mauritius.

item.title: Police hunt middle-age man who sexually assaulted girl, 14, in broad daylight near Weymouth beach
item.description: Police are hunting for a middle-aged man who lifted up a 14-year-old girl's top and inappropriately touched her bottom on Weymouth's seafront in broad daylight last Tuesday.

item.title: Plastic waste soared during lockdown as British households generated 25 per cent more than usual
item.description: The 'Everyday Plastic Survey' saw some 483 people across the UK store up and record the extent of their household's plastic waste for a week during lockdown.

item.title: Young opossums cling to mummy as they cross the road in Menomonee Park, Wisconsin
item.description: Adorable images show the mother marsupial making a mad dash across the road in Menomonee Park, Wisconsin with her babies clutching onto her back and tail.

item.title: BBC Breakfast host Naga Munchetty in hot water over paid corporate PR video for Aston Martin
item.description: The BBC Breakfast presenter, who earns up to £195,000 per year, hosted a webinar video for the luxury carmaker without gaining approval from her employer or declaring her fee for the promo.

item.title: Meghan Markle sends her thanks and personally calls fan for charity work
item.description: Meghan Markle, who is living in LA with Prince Harry, expressed her gratitude to the fan after their social media effort, titled #InspiredByMeghan, saw $80,000 donations made to CAMFED.

item.title: Pictured: Girl, 12, who tragically died after getting into trouble in river
item.description: The body of 12-year-old Ava Gray was pulled last night from the River Leven in the West Dunbartonshire village of Balloch following a three-hour search.

item.title: At least 20 more migrants arrive in UK waters after early morning Channel crossing
item.description: Up to 20 migrants have been met by Border Force officials off the coast of Dover this morning, as French authorities insist they are working to stop the illegal crossings.

item.title: Flytippers dump mountain of junk on 4,000-year-old Bronze Age burial ground in Wales
item.description: Visitors to the home of a 4000-year-old Bronze Age burial mound in Wales were shocked to find it trashed with mounds of rubbish including sofas, kitchen appliances and rotting food.

item.title: Number of Covid-19 patients needing hospital treatment has plummeted by 96% since April, data shows
item.description: The proportion of Covid-19 patients going to hospital appears to have halved in England since the end of April and doctors say better treatments and fewer patients overall are improving survival.

item.title: Wayne Lineker, 58, says haters 'mean absolutely nothing' to him
item.description: Wayne Lineker has hit back at haters after a video was shared of him picking which 'dream doll' to take on a date at his club in Ibiza - knocking them in the pool by their chests.

item.title: Are Boris, Carrie and Wilfred going CAMPING? PM off to Scotland to 're-read story of Athens plague'
item.description: The trio will journey north for some family time away from No10, Mr Johnson's first vacation since the pandemic struck. But the PM will not entirely be getting away from the coronavirus battle.

item.title: Metal detectorist unearths `nationally significant´ Bronze Age objects
item.description: Mariusz Stepien was searching a field near Peebles in June when he found a complete horse harness and sword dating from 1000 to 900 BC.

item.title: Mother drowns in front of her son and his friend after jumping into the sea to save them in Norfolk
item.description: The woman, who was in her 30s and has been named locally as Danni, was pulled lifeless from the water after being caught out by the strong current at Waxham, Norfolk.

item.title: Gavin Williamson slaps down unions' bid to 'sabotage' school reopening
item.description: Boris Johnson warned it is 'not right' that pupils should spend more time out of the classroom, reiterating his determination for a full return when term begins.

item.title: Mother-of-three survives on a diet of just chicken nuggets and crisps
item.description: Michaela Harris, 26, from Middlesbrough was diagnosed with avoidant restrictive food intake disorder (ARFID) an extreme form of fussy eating, following a difficult breakup in 2016.

item.title: Billionaire wanted: Britain's second most expensive home hits market for £185m
item.description: The John Nash-designed mansion, 1-18 York Terrace East, overlooks Regent's Park and would become the second most expensive house sale in the UK if snapped up for the asking price.

item.title: Syrian activist Hassan Akkad slams 'myth' that migrants flock to Britain for benefits
item.description: Bafta-winning documentary maker and NHS worker Hassan Akkad told Good Morning Britain 'we don't want to see dead bodies on The Channel,' during a debate on migration.

item.title: Prince Harry says it will take 'every single one of us' to defeat racism
item.description: In a clip of the new interview with Rashad Robinson released over the weekend, the Duke of Sussex, 35, praised the younger generation for 'acting, rather than just saying'.

item.title: Cold, flu and bronchitis infections fell 'well below average' during coronavirus lockdown
item.description: A report by the Royal College of GPs shows rates for these viruses fell drastically when the UK locked down in late March. Ten times fewer were going to their GP with a cold last month.

item.title: Daughter, 29, avoids jail for glassing her own mother in the face
item.description: Jade Rhodes, 29, attacked her mother Joanne following a pub crawl in Manchester, just weeks after she was given a suspended sentence after assaulting an emergency worker.

item.title: Illegal rave on Kent beach sees revellers ignore social distancing rules
item.description: The event, on Greatstone beach, Romney Marsh, started at around 3.30pm on Sunday - after plans for an unofficial 'beach cookout' in nearby Camber Sands, East Sussex, were foiled by police.

item.title: Model sent topless photo of man's chest after offering to help mental health page Happiness Project
item.description: Zoe Cain, 29, from Wales, reached out to The Happiness Project on social media offering to help out after being inspired by the organisation's positive daily messages.

item.title: Terrifying moment giant rocks suddenly tumble down a mountain and crashes into a busy road in China
item.description: Heart-stopping dashcam footage shows the huge stones tumbling down the mountain slope before smashing into a stream of cars in south-western Chinese province Sichuan on Saturday.

item.title: Rad grad! Student rides a wakeboard in his cap and gown for high school graduation photograph
item.description: Amazing footage shows Andrew Shaffer, 17, putting his graduation cap and gown on while riding a wakeboard at Lake Powell, Utah.

item.title: Perseid meteor shower 2020 peaks this week filling the sky with up to 100 shooting stars an hour
item.description: The shower actually started in mid-July but won't reach its full illumination until the Earth passes through the bulk of the debris between August 11 and August 13.

item.title: Woman with two wombs whose chances of conceiving were halved defies odds to welcome a miracle baby
item.description: Emma Johns, 27, from Goole, East Yorkshire, was told by doctors that she has two wombs when she was 17. But, to her surprise she fell pregnant with baby Olive a month after coming off the Pill.

item.title: WeChat removal could hit iPhone sales in China, analyst predicts
item.description: The removal of the massively popular chat platform, owned by Chinese tech giant Tencent, could adversely impact iPhone sales in the country.

item.title: 'I'm black, my friend's black and he's got a fairly decent car': Dawn Butler on Met Police car stop
item.description: Labour's Dawn Butler this morning again questioned why police stopped her as they drove through London, adding 'all I can tell you factually is I'm black, my friend is black and he's got a decent car'.

item.title: Sales executive earning £750k a year wins sex discrimination claim against 'old boys network'
item.description: Nadine Lee's male bosses at a tech company's London office 'went behind her back' by stripping her of her multi-million pound accounts and giving them to new salesmen, a tribunal heard.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson calls Princess Beatrice 'a natural angel of kindness and goodness'
item.description: The Duchess of York, 60, shared an illustration of Princess Beatrice on Instagram to mark the royal's 32nd birthday alongside a caption in which she called her daughter 'a natural angel'.

item.title: Indonesian volcano Mount Sinanbung spews Ash three miles into the air in spectacular eruption
item.description: Mount Sinabung on the island of Sumatra, Indonesia erupted for the second time in three days on Monday. The volcano spewed a giant cloud of thick, hot ash three miles into the air.

item.title: Wales opens children's SOFT PLAY centres from today
item.description: Facilities in the rest of the UK have still not been given a date to get back up and running.

item.title: Ex-MI6 chief urges ministers to stop their children from using TikTok over Chinese spying
item.description: Nigel Inkster said that the controversial social media app could provide a backdoor for Beijing to steal secrets from high-ranking members of the Government.

item.title: Simon Cowell tweets from hospital bed after breaking back in fall from new electric bike
item.description: On Sunday night, Cowell, 60, tweeted: 'Some good advice... If you buy an electric trail bike, read the manual before you ride it for the first time.' He went on: 'Thank you to everyone for your kind messages.'

item.title: Birmingham family are turned away by police from packed beach at Durdle Door after SIX-hour drive
item.description: Dorset Traffic Cops, the official Facebook page for Dorset Police Traffic Unit, had earlier posted there were road closures to restrict access to the packed beach.

item.title: Explosives expert claims Beirut blast was caused by burning military missiles - not ammonium nitrate
item.description: Danilo Coppe, 56 and from Parmesan in Italy, is one of the country's leading explosive experts. He believes the blast was not caused by ammonium nitrate because the colour of the cloud was orange.

item.title: TV SAS star Ant Middleton is forced to QUIT Royal Navy role after 'scum' tweet about BLM protesters
item.description: According to The Sun , Middleton, 39, was given the option to quit or be sacked, with a source explaining: 'He never thought he'd be given such a difficult choice.'

item.title: Spanish police break up coronavirus infection party
item.description: More than 60 people were found camping on an out-of-bounds Tenerife beach in what police called a 'get-together on the beach to spread Covid-19'.

item.title: DOMINIC LAWSON: Pitiful 'can't do' attitude of union that puts teachers firmly before pupils
item.description: DOMINIC LAWSON: Perhaps wisely, given his picaresque personal history, Boris Johnson has never been one to base his politics on an appeal to morality. But he did so yesterday.

item.title: BBC Breakfast's Carol Kirkwood leaves viewers in stitches with live gaffe
item.description: BBC Breakfast's Carol Kirkwood left viewers in stitches after she accidentally announced she had seen 'lots of doggers' rather than 'joggers' during a live segment

item.title: Police step up patrols in West End after boy, 17, was stabbed to death
item.description: Shoppers looked on in horror as Jeremy Meneses-Chalarca was chased by a man wielding a machete, just hours before another stabbing and shooting in a night of bloodshed in London.

item.title: Official UK daily coronavirus death toll could be SCRAPPED after row over PHE 'exaggerating' tally
item.description: Britain paused its daily update of the death toll last month and the government ordered a review after academics said the daily figures may include people who died of other causes.

item.title: Formula One grid girl, 33, who appeared on The Real Housewives of Cheshire dies
item.description: Formula One grid girl Khloe Atkinson, from Norton Heights, Stoke-on-Trent, passed away in her sleep just two days after her 33rd birthday.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's British ex-PA Emmy Tayler, 45, 'has left UK' in wake of former boss's US arrest
item.description: Oxford-born Emmy Tayler, 45, worked for Maxwell in the early 2000s is considered a possible key witness by New York prosecutors who have charged Maxwell.

item.title: We weren't expecting that, Mr Bond! Survey reveals Britons' favourite 007 actors
item.description: While Sean Connery has been voted Britain's favourite Bond, Roger Moore and current Bond Daniel Craig failed to make it into the top three.

item.title: Meghan Markle guided Prince Harry on his public 'journey to wokeness'
item.description: Meghan Markle played a pivotal role in helping Prince Harry become more attuned to racism, according to the authors of Finding Freedom Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand.

item.title: Scientists find way to ramp up flavour of the super-strength garlic or create less pungent versions
item.description: Researchers have unlocked the key to garlic's distinctive aroma. And that means they should be able to use their findings to produce super-strength varieties for the supermarket shelves.

item.title: White labrador gives birth to 13 puppies and each one has black coat
item.description: The golden-coated pet gave birth to a baker's dozen of pups. Owner Catherine Smith, 37 was amazed when the puppies kept on coming after three-year-old Lucy went into labour

item.title: Pensioners who are angry at BBC plans to strip over-75s of free TV licence
item.description: Campaigners are demanding a further stay of execution on the delayed move and want the Government to intervene. Some over-75s insist they will not stump up.

item.title: 'Lost Tory decade' of social care funding could be the result of ageism, new report warns
item.description: Report author Professor Jon Glasby said the impact of social care cuts had been particularly felt in services for older people, with those for the working-age population less affected.

item.title: Nearly 140k jobs are lost in one month
item.description: Figures on Wednesday are widely expected to show that the UK's economy contracted massively during the second quarter following the imposition of the virus lockdown.

item.title: New PPI gold rush: Ruling on hidden fees may spark millions of fresh payout claims
item.description: Banks could now face demands for more PPI payouts - even from people who were happy with their policy - after courts found the products were 'unfair' because of hidden commission fees.

item.title: Army now probes 'career-ending' bullying claims against Falklands hero's son
item.description: Major General Rupert Jones, 51, previously Britain's highest-ranking soldier in Iraq and whose father was Falklands hero, will face the Army Board over two misconduct charges.

item.title: Coronavirus outbreak linked to pub BBQ as 70 customers told to self-isolate
item.description: Three people, including staff, who attended a barbecue at the Soho Foundry Tavern in Smethwick, West Midlands, have tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: 'Bonfire of jobs' with a THIRD of firms planning lay offs this autumn
item.description: Shock research found huge numbers of companies expect to axe roles in the third quarter of the year as coronavirus hammers the economy.

item.title: FEMAIL tries out hilarious FREE face swap on some famous faces
item.description: REFACE enables users to morph one famous face onto another's body - and the AI technology also works with your own selfies. Here, FEMAIL uses it to transform US and UK stars and royals.

item.title: PICTURED: Ant McPartlin's ex Lisa Armstrong enjoys park date with new man as she finds love again
item.description: The make-up artist, 43, put on a cosy display with her handsome companion as they hugged and giggled while taking her beloved Labrador Hurley for a walk in a London park earlier this week.

item.title: The tiniest victim of Beirut blast: Girl, 3, dies of her injuries following explosion
item.description: When the second major blast struck Beirut, the impact of the explosion ripped Alexandra Naggear out of her mother's arms. It took several minutes for her parents to dig her out from under the rubble.

item.title: Donald Trump says he should be on Mount Rushmore: President says it sounds like a 'good idea'
item.description: Donald Trump said on Sunday night it 'sounds like a good idea' to add him to Mount Rushmore, after a New York Times article claimed a White House aide enquired about the possibility.

item.title: I froze my embryos to lose 7 stone in a last-ditch bid to have the baby I long for
item.description: Alice Dogruyol froze her embryos at a fertility clinic close to her Wimbledon home. The 43-year-old says overhauling her diet has helped her to shed around 7st to improve her chances of pregnancy.

item.title: Boris Johnson plans to set targets for police in bid to increase number of rape case prosecutions
item.description: British police forces could be set targets for the number of rape cases they refer to prosecutors, and the CPS may also be given quotas for how many suspects they take to court.

item.title: ALISON BOSHOFF: As Coleen and Rebekah enjoy luxurious holidays, who wins the battle of the beach?
item.description: ALISON BOSHOFF: Before that court showdown we have the spectacle of the WAGs' competing holidays. It's clear that Becky's is the beta version of Coleen's alpha super-break.

item.title: Heart-stopping moment man climbs out of window and dangles child from ledge above 10ft drop
item.description: A man dangled a child from a ledge above a ten foot drop in Station Road, Wakefield, west Yorkshire, yesterday. The man in shorts and sandals hung from the window while crowds gathered below.

item.title: People reveal the VERY dumb things they did as kids
item.description: People from across globe have taken to US-based site Whisper to reveal the dumbest things they've done when they were children - including electrocuting themselves.

item.title: We reveal the cheapest and most expensive motors to keep on the road
item.description: Although production of Skoda's vehicle has been discontinued, those who own a Yeti will pay an average annual premium of just £282, according to MoneySuperMarket.

item.title: How to grow a living room houseplant using an AVOCADO seed
item.description: An Australian plant enthusiast and YouTuber has revealed how to grow stunning living room houseplants using avocado seeds.

item.title: Hong Kong police raid pro-democracy newspaper, arrest owner
item.description: Lai, 71, was led away in handcuffs and arrested along with six others on suspicion of colluding with foreign forces - one of the new offences under the new Hong Kong law - and fraud.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews last night's TV: Moaning about a soaking on the flume? Don't be so wet!
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Royal watchers desperate for a glimpse of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex in Windsor won't get much joy if they hang around outside Frogmore Cottage.

item.title: Idyllic Lewes in Sussex is hotbed of revolution, according to social media group
item.description: The riverside town, overlooked by a Norman castle and peppered with boutiques and antiques shops, is a hotbed of revolution, according to Facebook page the Lewes Maoist Action group.

item.title: Feminist icon of the 1970s Gloria Steinem says she's never regretted not having children
item.description: American activist Gloria Steinem has said on the How To Fail podcast with Elizabeth Day that she does not think her life is 'unfulfilled' without children.

item.title: JK Rowling's publisher asked transgender activists to edit court report covering free speech ruling
item.description: Hachette, the publisher of JK Rowling's children's book The Ickabog, invited trans rights charity Mermaids to edit a court report covering a free speech ruling in its A-level Law Review magazine.

item.title: Beauty expert Chloe Morello shares her simple trick for a 60-second face lift without any surgery
item.description: A beauty expert has revealed her simple trick for giving herself a face lift within one minute, without any needles or surgery. Chloe Morello, 29, said she does it when wearing winged eyeliner.

item.title: Jamie Oliver's everyday heroes: From perfect peppers to roasted broccoli
item.description: JAMIE OLIVER: We're keeping things simple, pushing maximum flavour with minimum effort. We want fun, and we want solid, super-tasty recipes that consistently deliver.

item.title: Mum removes unsightly lint balls from her sofa by shaving the fabric with an electric razor
item.description: In a video shared on Facebook, the Australian woman shears lint balls from a cushion with an electric beard trimmer. Hundreds have branded it the 'most satisfying' thing they've watched this year.

item.title: Home cook reveals the VERY quick and easy working lunch she swears by
item.description: A savvy Australian home cook has inspired hundreds of others to meal prep after sharing an easy recipe for a quick work day or weekend lunch.

item.title: Woman whose acne covered 'every inch' of her face claims natural serum cleared skin in FOUR weeks
item.description: Taylor Setterfield, 20, from Chichester, who first developed acne in her teens, has claimed a £12.95 natural silver serum helped to clear her skin in just four weeks.

item.title: 'Boat mafia' of traffickers sets up base in Brussels to smuggle migrants across the Channel
item.description: Some 1,000 arrivals are using the city as an alternative staging post to France from which to plan their entry to the UK. Every bed in hostels, hotels and charity refuges across Brussels is full.

item.title: Ex-Navy chief Admiral Lord West backs Priti Patel's call for ships to combat people-smuggling
item.description: Admiral Lord West's supports the plan by Home Secretary Priti Patel for military resources to help stop people trafficking saying Britain lacked sufficient ships to ensure security of the coastline.

item.title: The scorched earth of Surrey: Devastating image reveals the damage left by wildfire
item.description: Around 140 acres of Chobham Common, Surrey, went up in flames after the fire broke out on Friday, forcing 100 residents to flee their homes. Pictured is the devastation left by the fire.

item.title: Allana Kirkwood lifts tough stains from stovetop with bicarbonate of soda and drenched tea towels
item.description: After leaving the towels overnight, the mum from Tasmania found deeply ingrained dirt wiped off easily with a single swipe of the cloth - no scrubbing required.

item.title: Protesters clash with riot police as 'Europe's last dictator' secures another landslide in Belarus
item.description: Crowds of protesters demanding an end to the rule of 'Europe's last dictator' clashed with police on the streets of Belarus last night.

item.title: Bid to unmask Jack the Ripper with forensic evidence from final victim thwarted by Catholic church
item.description: Dr Wynne Weston-Davies, 76, believes his great aunt was Jack the Ripper's final victim Mary Jane Kelly, who is buried in St Patrick's Catholic cemetery in Leytonstone, east London.

item.title: From Mexican chicken to pasta carbonara: The four ingredient recipes lazy home cooks swear by
item.description: Lazy home cooks have shared some of the four-ingredient recipes they swear by when they feel as though they can't be bothered to make dinner - including carbonara and Mexican chicken.

item.title: Translator's daughter, 6, reveals ordeal after she was seized from street in Afghanistan
item.description: Six year-old Wajia said she had a knife held to her face as she was told by her Taliban kidnappers: 'I will kill you and your infidel father.' The terrified youngster was hit in the face when she cried.

item.title: Police officer who was hit by hijacked car supports calls for harsher sentences for cop killers
item.description: PC Gareth Phillips, who was run over by a car thief, said he was 'totally' behind the campaign launched by PC Harper's widow for police killers to receive an automatic life sentence with no parole.

item.title: My lightbulb moment: Beauty innovator Kayleigh Graham
item.description: Kayleigh Graham, 31, who lives in Brighton, started Lily England five years ago. She revealed the inspiration for the business came from spotting how the fashion industry adapts to trends.

item.title: Shh! Anti-agers no one but you need know about: What's the best way to soothe my dry hands?
item.description: An anonymous reader asked Inge van Lotringen for advice on healing their raw and sore hands. The British beauty expert suggested using a few drops of face oil to treat hands before sleeping.

item.title: This is what 81 looks like
item.description: Susan Stanley-Carroll, 81, from London, has two sons and three grandchildren. The retired teacher revealed the importance of investing in a simple skincare regime for a youthful appearance.

item.title: Christian reverend says 1973 cult classic The Exorcist is 'real' in how it portrayals exorcisms
item.description: Reverend Bill Bean claims he has witnessed levitations, bizarre displays of superhuman strength and has even seen people's entire eyes change color during his seven years as an exorcist

item.title: She partied with Jagger and posed topless for Warhol
item.description: Cornelia Cochrane Churchill Guest who lives in Dallas, Texas, first appeared in Vogue at the age one and in later life posed topless for Warhol. She has found new fame in Sex And Vanity.

item.title: Twins separated at birth in cruel secret experiment reveal how they found each other
item.description: Identical twins separated at birth in a cruel experiment have spoken for the first time about how they found each other after a chance encounter at a pancake restaurant.

item.title: Northern France is the perfect short break - and it's just a simple ferry ride or Eurotunnel away
item.description: Sometimes the best things in life are right under your nose. And that's the case with Northern France, that bit Britons normally fly over or zoom past on the Eurostar on their way to Paris or Provence...
